Work.Name: Walmart Global Tech
Work.description:
- I was a Software Development Engineer II at Walmart, within the supply chain operations of Sam's Club. My primary focus was on Post-Fulfilment (Financials), and I played a key role in a modernization initiative that involved building a new Order Management System based on microservices architecture.
 - In this initiative, I led the modernization efforts for the invoicing service, catering to 69 million Sam's Club customers across the United States. The new system achieved a processing speed of 10,000 records per minute, significantly reducing accounting discrepancies from $44 million to $8 million. 
 - Over the span of two years, I contributed to various projects, including Healer Service, Distributed ID Generator, and State Machine for Order Orchestration. In addition to my technical involvement in multiple projects, I mentored four colleagues and received a Bravo Award for exceptional time management and collaboration skills in a fast-paced environment.

 - Established a metric for optimizing order fulfillment by initiating calculations on Perfect Order Index.

Projects.name: List of Media
Projects.description:
Here is my list of media I use.

  1. Videos:
    1. - I use YouTube, Netlfix and Peacock
    2. - The shows I tend to watch are Friends, The Modern Family, The 70's Show and Games of Thrones.
    3. - The movies I have loved so far are The Batman Trilogy, Inception, Interstellar, La La Land and Blade Runner 2049.
    4. - I follow football and watch live matches of Manchester United.
  2. Social Media:
    1. - Instagram
  3. Communication:
    1. - WhatsApp, iMessage, Email
  4. Music:
    1. - Spotify is the only app I use for Music

Projects.name: Types of Media
Projects.description:
1. Print Media refers to printed materials like books and magazines.
  2. Broadcast Media includes information transmitted through mass communication channels like telivision, radio.
  3. Digital Media is the content distributed online.
  4. Visual Media consists of movies, documentaries, photography, and graphics.


There are multiple ways you can classify the media: based on the medium, based on the end user, based on the content, and a lot more. In the next slide, we will look further into visual media, especially movies.

Projects.name: Visual Media
Projects.description: Visual media can be broadly classified into images, videos and interactive media. Images can be further classified into photographs, digital art, infographics, posters, etc. The content delivered to user is static. The dynamic visual content is a part of videos. They vary from educational to entertainment, from recorded to live. Interative media includes VR/AR where there is a constant interaction between user and the medium. We will talk about movies in the next slide.

Projects.name: Movies
Projects.description:
Based on the genre we can classify movies as below:

  1. Drama: Classic, period TV series Peaky Blinders
  2. Comedy: Rowan Atkinson's Mr. Bean
  3. Action/Adventure: Action-filled Top Gun: Maveric
  4. Science Fiction: One of my favorites, Interstellar
  5. Horror: Well renowned, The Conjuring
  6. Animation: The kids' favorite, Kung fu panda
  7. And a special category, Wes Anderson Movies: Just for his unique direction, The Grand Budapest Hotel

Projects.name: Challenges in Movie industry
Projects.description:
There are various challenges, from production to consumption, in the film industry. Below are a few challenges:

  1. Language Barrier: Beautiful movies are produced every year across the globe, providing quality content. But due to the language barrier, movies fail to circulate around the world. Although most of the movies are dubbed in other languages, they lose their visual authenticity.
  2. Deepfake Technology: It has a lot of potential in movie creation and visual effects, but it also poses significant ethical concerns. It can be a potential threat to an actor's career.
  3. Oversaturation: Due to the abundance of content online, the material gets saturated. This leads to the development of certain movie types that are far from authentic and poetic naration.

Projects.name: Challenges as Consumer Or Producer
Projects.description:
Below are a few challenges:

  1. - With the increase in OTT platforms, the theater experience is lost, as more and more consumers tend to enjoy the movie from their home.
  2. - Movies in the current generation prioritize quantity over quality. Certain elements are added to the movie to induce a spike in the audience, although they might not add meaning to the overall plot.
  3. - As content producers, it is very hard to capture audience attention due to the influence of Instagram and TikTok.

CommonTheme.name: Common Themes
CommonTheme.description:
1. Media Consumption

I noticed similarities among the media forms that students consume. A large number of students use similar applications, especially social media applications like Instagram. There is a general interest in video-based media consumption on YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.

CommonTheme.name: Common Themes
CommonTheme.description:
2. Games

It's been quite some time since I have spent an evening playing games. But I found a few students who have similar interests. Overcooked on Nintendo, absolute gem of a game to play with friends and the only reason to pull an all-nighter on a weekday (Prachi). Call of duty and Valorant (Shreyas, Romey)

CommonTheme.name: Common Themes
CommonTheme.description:
3. Effects of media consumption

Few students have expressed their discontent regarding social media platforms. The general essence revolves around the abundance of content, the usage of AI algorithms to grab our attention, and the time spent on these platforms. Rohan rightly expresses it as a rabbit hole. Khanh highlights how shortform videos have changed the influencers' game on social media.

CommonTheme.name: Revision
CommonTheme.description: The spectrum of media classification and categorization on students webpages is huge. After going through these web pages, I feel I could have done a better job presenting various media forms. Another fact I noticed is that some challenges mentioned by students exhibit a completely different way of thinking. Thinking from this perspective would have helped me add a few more points to my first assignment.
